definition: head rope of a fishing net/guiding principle/key link/class (taxonomy)/outline/program
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
common program/formal program of the communist party after 1949, that served as interim national plan
Felix Klein's Erlangen program (1872) on geometry and group theory
pinyin: Ai1 er3 lang3 gen1 gang1 ling3

sentences.english: What point in the antislavery creed would you have me argue?
sentences.chinese: 關於反奴隸制的綱領你們要我說明哪一點呢？

sentences.english: We must uphold the maximum programme of the Party in dialectical unity.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該在辯證統一中堅持黨的最高綱領。
然後有德國的最低綱領主義者。

sentences.english: Thirdly, it is a political creed and an asocial practical movement.
sentences.chinese: 是一種政治綱領和社會實踐運動。

sentences.english: The first is the Basic Program and the second is the Regional Center Pilot Program.
sentences.chinese: 第一基本綱領，第二經濟特區移民方案。

sentences.english: The Montagnards had no common programme generally acknowledged by all its members.
sentences.chinese: 山嶽派沒有被認可的共同綱領。

sentences.english: They are the political declaration and action plan for our party in the new development stage of the new century.
sentences.chinese: 是我們黨在新世紀新階段的政治宣言和行動綱領。

sentences.english: Mrs Chan's campaign platform called for full democracy in Hong Kong in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 陳太的競選綱領要求2012年香港實行普選。

sentences.english: I. Lakatos, a Methodologist of Research Programmes or a Philosopher of Political Practices?
sentences.chinese: 一個研究綱領方法論者，或是一個政治實踐的哲學家？

sentences.english: The Outcome Document is a guiding document for the future work of the UN and pointed out the right direction for the development of the UN.
sentences.chinese: 這是指導聯合國今後工作和發展方向的綱領性文件。

sentences.english: Bacon offered a fascinating program for future generations .
sentences.chinese: 貝肯對後代人提出了一個吸引人的綱領。

sentences.english: Common Program of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, article 28.
sentences.chinese: 《中國人民政治協商會議共同綱領》第28條。

sentences.english: As regards party tasks, Lenin considered it essential to change the programme.
sentences.chinese: 關於黨的任務，列寧認爲必須修改黨的綱領。

sentences.english: It was a platform deeply shaken by her own untimely death.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這一綱領已被她自己不合時宜的死所深深動搖。

sentences.english: It is a program of action guiding China's trans - century population and family planning work.
sentences.chinese: 是指導我國跨世紀人口與計劃生育工作的行動綱領。

sentences.english: Take as our main text, the Critique of the Gotha Programme.
sentences.chinese: 看我們的主要文本《哥達綱領批判》。

definition: to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
to take turns/to work by roster
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to lift restrictions (such as curfew or martial law)
